title: The behavior of method ·`unwarp_or` and method `unwarp_or_else` of `Result` is inconsistent
body:
I tried this code: [dataset](https://github.com/franklucky001/nl-readers/blob/master/src/dataset.rs) line 155 ```rust fn samples_to_records( samples: Vec, vocab: &BTreeMap, class2id: & HashMap) -> Vec>{ samples .into_iter() .map(|s|( s.text.chars() .into_iter() .map(|c|*vocab.get(&c.to_string()).unwrap_or(&0)) .collect(), s.label .parse::() .map_err(|e|{ eprintln!("num {:?} parse error {}", s.label, e); e }) // .unwrap_or( // *class2id.get(&s.label) // .expect(&format!("invalid label {}", &s.label)) // ) .unwrap_or_else(|e|{ *class2id.get(&s.label) .expect(&format!("invalid label {}, error {}", &s.label, e)) } ) ) ) .map(|(word_ids, label_id)|ClassifierRecord::new(word_ids, label_id)) .collect() } } ``` I expected to see this happen: both `unwrap_or` and `unwrap_or_else`can consistently capture errors or work ok Instead, this happened: when parse `str` value "3" to `usize` - panic, use method `unwarp_or`, and `map_err` seem not work either - all it's ok, use method `unwrap_or_else` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.61.0 (fe5b13d68 2022-05-18) binary: rustc commit-hash: fe5b13d681f25ee6474be29d748c65adcd91f69e commit-date: 2022-05-18 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.61.0 LLVM version: 14.0.0 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'main' panicked at 'invalid label 3', src\dataset.rs:157:30 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff76dccbddf - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::dbghelp::trace at /rustc/fe5b13d681f25ee6474be29d748c65adcd91f69e\/library\std\src\..\..\backtrace\src\backtrace\dbghelp.rs:98 1: 0x7ff76dccbddf - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized at /rustc/fe5b13d681f25ee6474be29d748c65adcd91f69e\/library\std\src\..\..\backtrace\src\backtrace\mod.rs:66 2: 0x7ff76dccbddf - std::sys_common::backtrace::_print_fmt at /rustc/fe5b13d681f25ee6474be29d748c65adcd91f69e\/library\std\src\sys_common\backtrace.rs:66 3: 0x7ff76dccbddf -
